steps: Verify DNS client servers.

scenarios.title: Potential Issue – Time source or sync failure
steps: Query Windows Time status and configuration.
Use domain hierarchy (NT5DS) for domain-joined.
Resync and verify offset and Kerberos.

scripts.name: Reset time sync
scripts.code:
w32tm /query /status
w32tm /query /configuration
w32tm /config /syncfromflags:DOMHIER /update
net stop w32time
net start w32time
w32tm /resync /force

scenarios.title: Potential Issue – BitLocker not enabled
steps: Check TPM and OS drive protectors.
Enable BitLocker and add recovery key.

scripts.name: Enable BitLocker
scripts.code:
Get-Tpm
$os=(Get-BitLockerVolume | ? VolumeType -eq 'OperatingSystem')
Enable-BitLocker -MountPoint $os.MountPoint -TpmProtector
Add-BitLockerKeyProtector -MountPoint $os.MountPoint -RecoveryPasswordProtector | Out-Null

scenarios.title: Potential Issue – Defender disabled or stale
steps: Re-enable real-time protection; update signatures.

scripts.name: Defender quick fix
scripts.code:
Set-MpPreference -DisableRealtimeMonitoring $false -Force
Update-MpSignature
Get-MpComputerStatus | Select AMServiceEnabled,AntivirusEnabled,RealTimeProtectionEnabled,SignatureVersion

scenarios.title: Potential Issue – Time source or sync failure
steps: Query Windows Time status and configuration.
Use domain hierarchy (NT5DS) for domain-joined.
Resync and verify offset and Kerberos.

scripts.name: Reset time sync
scripts.code:
w32tm /query /status
w32tm /query /configuration
w32tm /config /syncfromflags:DOMHIER /update
net stop w32time
net start w32time
w32tm /resync /force
